Description: Blue glazed heart-scarab, fragment of, striated elytra, two vertically pierced holes near front legs, concave base decorated with a linear pattern. EA 18537 (1887,0101.94 + 1887,0101.96) forms the left wing of this winged scarab
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie (?)
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Gumaiyima, East side of the temenos? (?)
Curator's comments: Part of 1887,0101.94 + 1887,0101.96 (EA 18537). Maybe the "part of a very fine winged scarab for inlaying" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 41, on the east side of Gumaiyima temenos
